message:
International Relations Cell is exhilarated to receive an overwhelming response to and interest of the student community in participating in the Semester Away Program. In the same regard, the cell invites all interested candidates to a One-on-One interaction with our members for clarification regarding the application process from 4:00 PM onward at our office(TSG 119) in Technology Students' Gymkhana on Sunday, 7th April, 2019.

It is highly recommended that students attend the event to smoothen their applications.

https://forms.gle/p7bS9EqaxM5G17pYA

URGENT NOTICE:

This is to hereby inform all students that the International Relations Cell has established a cooperation with University of Auckland, New Zealand and in the same regard, University of Auckland is now offering Fully Funded Summer Internships in areas related to Artificial Intelligence, Virtual Reality, Disease Management and climate change, applications of carbon in structures and development of high density EV Chargers. The Projects have a short deadline of only 24 hrs, ie by 23:59 on 5th April,2019.

The following steps are to be followed to complete the application:-

1) The student must not have any backlog and must not have any disciplinary action in his/her record.

2) The student will be jointly guided on the project by the IITKgp and UoA faculty team not only during the summer, but throughout the fourth year (as part of BTP or other project work).

3) If you are interested to apply, please select ONE project.

4) If there are more than one IITKGP supervisors for the project, please select ONE supervisor (column E of the xl file).  

5) Please write to the IITKGP supervisor before end of 5.4.19 expressing your interest. Please include in your package:

a) Your CV.

b) Your transcript.

c) A statement of your long term research interests (max 400 words).

d) A statement why your academic background is appropriate for the project (max 150 words).

e) What you hope to achieve through the internship (max 100 words).

6) You should feel free to request a face to face meeting with the supervisor.

Students are encouraged to complete their applications and send in their emails to the respective supervisors within this strict time frame to make themselves eligible for this opportunity.

Link to Project Details and list of supervisors:-https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1OhDSVldnWtomGuBc4-3OTNBuQMrIMsQe5Nh94rxT7qM/edit?usp=sharing

Important Notice.

This notice is in accordance with the prestigious Australia Awards Scholarship offered by the Australian Government to undertake full-time postgraduate study at participating Australian Universities and Technical and Further Education (TAFE) institutions for the students of developing countries. Scholarships are mainly at postgraduate level however there is a limited number of undergraduate scholarships (country specific) as well.

The deadline of the application has been extended to 8th April 2019.

NOTE: Special advantage will be given to Indian students.

For further details and application to the scholarship:
https://ircell.iitkgp.ac.in/
Link to IR webpage:
https://international.iitkgp.ac.in/upcoming_opportunities/…/

Ensuring quality higher education is one of the most important things we can do for future generations. With this in mind, International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur is delighted to organize the MS PhD panel discussion on the 27th of March, 2019. Do join in to hear from our esteemed panelist about how they got MS/PhD offers from top class universities and clear out all doubts you have regarding pursuing higher education. 
We'll see you in V3 (Vikramshila Complex) at 6:30 pm sharp on the 27th of March, 2019.
story: International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur is with Soumyamouli Pal and 5 others.

A German delegation comprising DAAD officials, the Director of German Research Foundation, representatives of German Universities and Consulate diplomats are visiting IIT Kharagpur to increase collaboration.
There is going to be a student interaction seminar on 15th of March,2019 at 6:00 p.m. in Bhatnagar Auditorium where student opportunities to study or research in Germany will be discussed. This will encompass student exchange, short-term internships and even further education. This is a great chance to know about the scholarships and funding opportunities in Germany - one of the frontiers of science and technology.
Hope to see you all there.

Pre-final years students have an excellent opportunity to apply for the Nagaoka Summer School for Young Engineers (NASSYE) in 2019. Nagaoka University of Technology (NUT) is offering students the opportunity to participate in research on the topics set by the laboratories at NUT, as well as cultural exchange. The university will accept 20 students for NASSYE 2019 and provide them scholarship. 
Application deadline is 5th April 2019.
Application procedure and details can be found at http://www.nagaokaut.ac.jp/e/kokusai/nassye.html

Close on the heels of setting up exchange programs with universities in Canada, the United States, Australia and Europe, IITKGP proudly presents the Asoke Deysarkar International Program (ADSIP) - a full scholarship program for SAARC nationals. Funded by distinguished alumnus, entrepreneur and philanthropist Dr. Asoke Deysarkar, the program supports full-time students and research scholars from SAARC countries to study at the most reputed technical institute in India.  Each application will go through a rigorous selection process and the successful candidates can spend a summer/ winter/ or an entire semester to study, work on a research project, collaborate with our global partners, and experience this unique country, all living and travel expenses paid. 

Interested students can get in touch at ir-office@adm.iitkgp.ac.in

Link to the Flyer: https://international.iitkgp.ac.in/static/website/ADSIPflyer201901291100.pdf

International Relations Cell brings out good news to the Dual Doctoral Degree students and to the students having Joint Supervisor from abroad. Financial support limited to Rs 1,00,000 plus INR equivalent to US$500 will be provided to the students who have registered under Dual Doctoral programme with a foreign university or have a Joint Supervisor from a recognised foreign university for International Travel. The student should have completed registration seminar before applying for such visit and the minimum stay in foreign should be of 90 days. The student will be reimbursed one time to and fro travel expenditure as per Government of India rule and visa charges only.

Back in the service of the student community, International Relations Cells announces the latest series of projects going live on the Foreign Training Portal starting today. With Internship offers from the likes of countries like France, Spain and Israel, the research topics include Artificial Intelligence, Deep Learning, Cyber Security, Microfluidics, Computer Vision and Signal processing in addition to others.
Strict Deadline: 12:00 Midnight, 31st January 2019.
Also in lieu of repeated requests, the deadlines for projects on microfluidics, biomedical and optics have been extended to the same.
Link to the FT Portal: https://ircell.iitkgp.ac.in/ftp/portal/

International Relations Cell is delighted to inform students of IIT Kharagpur about the MEXT scholarship by the University of Tokyo. The Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology (MEXT) scholarship is a government scholarship fully funded by Japan allowing international students to study in fully funded Japanese universities. The scholarship is for the international students who wish to study at Japanese universities as Undergraduate and Postgraduate students under the Japanese Government (MEXT) Scholarship Program. 
Application deadline around the END OF JANUARY. Online interview will be on Feb 18 or 19, at the India Office of the University of Tokyo, New Delhi.  

NOTE: Special advantage will be given to Indian students.The highest priority will be given to applicants with Indian nationality.  

The MEXT scholarship offers seven categories of scholarship. To know more click on the link:
https://www.in.emb-japan.go.jp/Education/japanese_government_scholarships.html

The application guidance for the scholarship is given in the following link: 
https://www.studyjapan.go.jp/pdf/applications/2019/2019_Guidelines_Undergraduate_E.pdf

For further information:
https://www.i.u-tokyo.ac.jp/edu/epiip/entra_e.shtml

We are excited to be back with the latest edition of International Newsletter. In addition to interesting insights into open International Scholarships and Competitions along with Indo-X Grants, it also includes our strong and continual commitment to make KGP go International!!

It has been a while since we set out on an endeavour to make KGP go International, and as a testimony of our commitment, it gives us immense pleasure to share the details of the latest research collaborations for Foreign Trainings which will be available in IR Cell’s FT Portal starting from today. Funded projects are available from the renowned universities like NTU Singapore, Technische Universität München ,University of Warwick, and the  research labs like the Bundesanstalt für Materialforschung und -prüfung,all of which are interested to hire UG,PG and RS students. It is our belief that such opportunities can bring a drastic scale-up in the research profiles of any level and hence students are advised to actively apply in large numbers in the fields of their choice.
In the best interest of the applicants, FT Portal has now been updated with a “Edit Your Profile” option, wherein all applicants need to upload their latest, CVs, SOPs and transcripts to continue to be eligible for the application process.
Note: UG, PG and RS candidates are eligible for the projects mentioned above.
Deadline: 20th January.
Here is the link to the portal: https://ircell.iitkgp.ac.in/ftp/portal/

IMPORTANT NOTICE:-

The application deadline for the projects from the University of Warwick has been extended to 7th January 2019 till 5 pm.

Please note that the projects are for the students of the departments of Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering and Metallurgical and Materials Engineering (Ph.D., M.tech and UG 3-4 Yr).

Project Details are as follows:

1.Additive Manufacturing of Aluminium Alloys- 1st yr M.Tech or 4th yr Dual Degree in Metallurgical Engineering

2.Coupled micro-forming and micro-joining methods to build functional components for

battery applications- 1st yr M.Tech  or 4th yr Dual Degree in Mechanical Engineering

3.Electron beam welding of coated DP steel to Al Alloys- 1st yr M.Tech or 4th yr Dual Degree in Metallurgical Engineering

4.X-ray computer tomography scanning for additive manufactured parts- 3rd or 4th yr Dual Degree in Industrial Engg. and Mgmt./ QEDM

5.Non-metallic inclusions (NMI) and its control in forged steel components- Ph.D. student in Metallurgical and Materials Engg

6.Developing Explainable Artificial Intelligence for Safety Arguments for Autonomous

Vehicles- 3rd or 4th yr Dual Degree in Computer Sc. and Engg, 1st yr MTech in Computer Sc. and Engg

7.Additive Manufacturing of Aluminium Alloys- Ph.D student in Metallurgical and Materials Engg

Here is the link to the portal:

https://ircell.iitkgp.ac.in/ftp/portal/

With this year coming to an end, we want to end this year on a high note, bringing in a few more exciting foreign internship opportunities.
We are glad to announce fully funded foreign training collaboration with University of Warwick, United Kingdom! The Collaboration involves a Foreign Internship during the summers for 8 weeks for Undergraduate students and 11 weeks for Postgraduate students under one supervisor each from Warwick Manufacturing Group and IIT Kharagpur, after which the students can complete their projects under the home supervisor .Projects under this collaboration can be found on IR Cell's FT portal, deadlines for same being 4th January '19. The student community is encouraged to put forward their applications for this one of a kind opportunity.

Link to the FT Portal: https://ircell.iitkgp.ac.in/ftp/portal/

International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur in association with IIT Kharagpur Foundation of USA presents before you the second version of International Internship Awards. Last year 11 meritorious students, achieved this prestigious award. To have a look at their achievements please visit: https://international.iitkgp.ac.in/exc_diaries/outbound_diaries/

To apply, kindly register on the FTP portal : https://ircell.iitkgp.ac.in/ftp/portal/ and go to the scholarships tab.

Kindly note: The awards are open to ALL students of IIT Kharagpur, irrespective of their year of education, country of visit, host institution and period of visit. Applications will be accepted through the FTP portal only.

International Relations Cell is proud to announce its collaboration with EPFL, Switzerland!. 
According to the agreement, IIT Kharagpur students will now be considered on a priority basis on the EPFL portal if they follow the following procedure:-
Complete application procedure as given on the EPFL website.
Login into FTP portal with the details along with generated registration-id (with same student details).
Moreover, we request the students who have applied earlier in the EPFL portal to follow the further steps.
Note: According to the terms of the collaboration, only those students who apply on both FT Portal and EPFL website will be considered.
Deadline: 15 Nov. 2018
FT Portal Link: https://ircell.iitkgp.ac.in/ftp/portal/login
EPFL Details Link: https://ic.epfl.ch/SummerAtEPFL
Kindly Note: The collaboration is only for EE, ECE & CS Students.

NTU-India Connect Research Internship Programme In Singapore is a university-wide short-term research programme lasting for 2 to 6 months. It is initiated to enable undergraduate and graduate students from Indian Universities and Institutes of higher learning to pursue research at NTU. Participants of this programme will work under the supervision of NTU faculty, develop a strong research interest and expertise in a given research field, experience multicultural living, gain a network of friends and a better understanding of Singapore. Eligible students may be given an allowance, and are expected to fulfil a minimum of 8 weeks research attachment comprising research project work at NTU. Interested students are requested to please go through the requirements document uploaded below and submit their recommendation forms to the OIR before Dec 26, 2018 to ensure their timely processing. Also, please note that people whose internship are MANDATORY can only apply.
Additional Information:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Mp0LBT0xzOIYbk-ZXx2-iLqXbg5eDUXy/view?usp=sharing
Recommendation form: 
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1TojbXfhvBy3JwfZHogjCLhfIs0cvP1lZ9WtEl8ZWv58/edit?usp=sharing

The efforts of budding researchers at IIT Kharagpur are now bearing fruit!. After receiving a massive response to the Foreign Training Program 2018-19, we announce the availability of latest series of FTP Projects. So, don’t wait and grab the opportunity.

International Relations Cell is pleased to announce that an array of the world-renowned professors have floated extremely fascinating projects listed below:

1.Using bioinformatic skill to analyze sequencing data.| 
   Cornell University.

2.HKUST-MIT Smart EeB project | Hong-Kong University 
   of Science and Technology.

3. Capillary-based Microfluidic Elastofiltration (MEF) 
    project | Hong-Kong University of Science and
    Technology.

4. Development of electronic skin | Tufts University.

5.Biorefinery of lignocellulosic residues from the agri-food 
   industry | Universidad de Cordoba.
    
 6. Smart City | Yuan Ze University.
        
 7.  Acoustic Signal Processing | Yuan Ze University.
  
 8.  Crowd AI | Yuan Ze University.
          
 9.Implementation of Numerical Routines for a Level Set 
    Method based Simulation Pipeline|Yachay     Tech 
    University.

 10. Visual Knowledge Discovery and Machine Learning | 
        Central Washington University.

 11. Software development: MobSink| Instituto Federal da 
       Bahia - Campus Valença.

 12.Analog and mixed-signal accelerators for machine 
      learning|Tufts University.

 13.CMOS Vision sensors- design and applications.|Tufts 
      University.

Deadline: 8th November.

Here is the link to the portal:

https://ircell.iitkgp.ac.in/ftp/portal/

Also, keep checking the upcoming opportunities page to stay updated with the new avenues of getting an international exposure.

https://international.iitkgp.ac.in/upcoming_opportunities/allevents/

The call for applications for the Charpak Exchange Scholarship (spring session) offered by the Embassy of France in India is currently open. The students need to submit their applications no later than Monday, November 5th,2018.
This scholarship is designed for exchange students from all the streams and fields of study, enrolled in an Indian institution, for a period of one to four months (duration of an academic semester) at the Bachelor’s or Master’s degree level. The Charpak Exchange Program offers Charpak AME Scholarship (Allocation Mensuelle d’Entretien) with the following benefits to scholarship awardees based on merit: 
- Living allowance of 615 euros.
- Medical insurance coverage (approx. 300 euros /academic year).
- Student visa fee waiver (16,500 INR approx).
- Assistance to find affordable student accommodation.
For further details related to the scholarship and its application process, we request you to kindly visit: https://lnkd.in/fBQu_yt
If you have any queries with regards to the scholarship, do not hesitate to write at scholarship.france@ifindia.in.

#Unique_Internship_Opportunity
Cisco USA has a 1 year all expenses paid internship for international students, where they work in real labs on real projects in San Jose, California, while delaying their graduation by 1 year. Several students have been through this program, and most of them also got job offers from Cisco, upon completion of their BTech or MTech. 
Note: This opportunity will require students to take a 1 year gap from their academics.
Deadline: October 22,2018
Eligibility: BTech 3rd year and MTech 1 st year students
Reference: https://myciip.com/signup/

Last summer, numerous students from IIT Khragpur travelled to different places all across the globe and successfully completed research internships under renowned professors in top-notch universities. Foreign Trainings are not easy to secure and even after securing one there are numerous difficulties that need to be resolved. How did they manage their finances? What language barriers did they face? 
International Relations Cell is proud to release the "Outbound Diaries" - a dynamic collection of students who visited foreign countries for internships and other activities. Get all your queries answered by reading the blogs of students who secured foreign internships last summers.
Refer to the following link: 
https://international.iitkgp.ac.in/exc_diaries/outbound_diaries/

International Relations Cell is delighted to inform students of IIT Kharagpur about the PennState university’s 1 year, non-thesis master of science degree program, which includes educating the students in the field of nanoscience and nanoengineering. The course is designed to train the students to meet the industry demands in the field of nano technology. Pursuing the course can also act as a added advantage while applying for PhDs.
For more details visit- https://www.esm.psu.edu/academics/graduate/ms-engineering-nano-scale.aspx

#Semester_Away 
The following opportunities are available for the students who wish to attend a foreign university in the upcoming spring and autumn semesters:

1. Technical University of Munich (MoU present):- https://www.international.tum.de/en/exchangestudents/
TUM is one of our partner universities and they accept students from their respective partner institutes through e-Nomination. The e-Nomination has to be done by IIT Kharagpur. Interested students may please send an email to irc@iitkgp.ac.in explaining the reason for wanting an exchange at TUM, along with uploading their CV and transcript. These emails should be sent by IST 23:59 Oct 20, 2018. Any email after the deadline will not be accepted. 

2. Tokyo Metropolitan University (MoU present):-   http://www.ic.tmu.ac.jp/english/study_abroad/study_abroad.html

3. University of São  Paulo:- 
http://www.usp.br/internationaloffice/en/index.php/admissions/undergraduate/exchange-student
IIT Kharagpur does not have an exchange partnership with the University of São Paulo, but applications can be submitted through the Office of International Relations.

4. University of Tokyo (MoU present):- https://www.u-tokyo.ac.jp/en/academics/ustep-type-u.html

5. University of Wisconsin:- https://studyabroad.wisc.edu/exchange/

We extend our best wishes to everyone who wish to apply to these universities as a visiting student.

International Relations Cell is overwhelmed to bring to IIT Kharagpur a new Semester Exchange Opportunity. In this one of a kind initiative, the very elegant, Tomas Bata University, Czech Republic is accepting students in an exchange program for the summers of academic session 2018-19. 
The link to apply to this exciting opportunity is :-https://www.utb.cz/en/university/international/students/exchange-students/incoming-students/
Students are requested to apply on or before November 1,2018.
The list of courses offered can be found at:-https://www.utb.cz/en/university/international/students/exchange-students/incoming-students/courses/
With hope that this gigantic step towards improvement of international relations will boost the spirits of the student community, we extend our best wishes and full co-operation to everyone aspiring for this semester exchange.

International Relations Cell presents before you the "2019 Mexican Government Scholarship program for International Students".
More than 90 Mexican Institutions are now open for all Indian Nationals interested in pursuing a specialization, master’s degree or doctorate, conducting graduate or postdoctoral research, or taking part in an undergraduate or graduate-level academic mobility program under the “2019 Mexican Government Scholarship program for International Students”.
Before applying for the scholarship, the prospective candidates must obtain a letter of acceptance from the participating Mexican institute of their choice.
Deadline for the scholarship application is 28th September 2018.

Link for Scholarship Portal: 
https://sigca.sre.gob.mx/

List of all participating Mexican Institutes: https://tinyurl.com/MexicanInstitutes

NOTE: Translate the web pages to English before proceeding.

After receiving an overwhelming response in the very first series of projects of FTP 2018-19, International Relations Cell is glad to announce the arrival of the second series of projects.
We have collaborated with WIN-MITACS which gives students a chance to work with research groups affiliated with startups.
Three exciting and fully funded projects are up on the portal!
Don’t miss this chance if you have ever thought of working in an industrial environment in a foreign country.
The deadline for applying for these projects is 15th September.
Here is the link to the FTP Portal: https://ircell.iitkgp.ac.in/ftp/portal/login/

#IIT_KGPs_Magnificance
IIT Kharagpur is one of the first institutes in India to support student-run startups. There are bodies which come up with a wide array of startup schemes and startup funds to encourage their growth.
Some of the dynamically growing startups of the institute are:
1.Mbreath
Started by: Laxmi Kant Tiwari(Masters in IIT Kharagpur) in 2015
It provides a wireless sleep tracking device with in-depth analytics using IoT, Big Data Analysis, Cloud Computing, Artificial Intelligence, and Machine Learning for home healthcare monitoring..
2.Agnext
Started by: Taranjeet Singh Bhamra, Mrigank Sharad and Deepak Jaiswal in 2016 
AgNext is an agricultural sensing and solutions company. They provide a unique platform for analytics-as-a-service using Agriculture Imagery & IOT devices.
3.Alive home
Started by: Poonam Gupta(in the year 2015)
Alive Home is a company, working on IoT based products which aims to provide luxury and home automation in an affordable way.
4. Capillary’ technologies
Started by: Aneesh Reddy, Ajay Modani, and Krishna Mehra
Capillary’s technology solutions provide platform integrates Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning to make it easy for brands to get deep understanding and insights into their consumers, engage consumers through personalized 1:1 communication, provide easy and connected cross-channel commerce experiences and build loyalty to reward and retain their best consumers.
To help you know more about our institute, IIT Kharagpur's Delegation is visiting USA from September 8, 2018 to September 17, 2018. So gear up and register at:
https://international.iitkgp.ac.in/faculty_form/IITKGP_delegate_visit/

All of us at the International Relations Cell strive incessantly towards the amelioration of IIT Kharagpur at the Global Stage. The Foreign Training and Research Talks was one such initiative, having students who worked at prestigious Universities like MIT, Kyoto University amongst others in the panel. The discussion that proceeded was an enlightening experience for the audience wherein a range of misconceptions were cleared and the application process was explained at length. We hope to boost the international participation and exposure of our students with these unique initiatives.
We extend our best wishes to each one who is trying to secure a Foreign Training this summers.

Time: 7:00 pm

Foreign Training Program (FTP) is a unique initiative by IR Cell through which students get an opportunity to pursue research internship in a foreign university. This program commenced last year with the motive of simplifying the complete process to secure an FT. It is very well said that every accomplishment starts with a decision to try, and certainly we have been able to accomplish this through FTP.
Now is the time to reveal the stats!
With around 20 projects garnered, 26 selected students and multiple overwhelming offers from various established universities such as Northeastern University, New Castle University, Stockholm University to mention a few, IR cell takes pride in announcing the grand success of the program. To add further to the list of our achievements, we received an invitation to collaborate with EPFL University, ranked 12th in the QS Ranking.
If you want some easy and quick avenues for your dream Universities, remain in touch with us. We have everything streamlined through the Foreign Training Program.
Don’t miss the chance to add a golden feather to your hat…

From the first IIT to a world class institute, the journey that IIT Kharagpur has had is incredible. Climbing the ladders of success with every passing year and proving its worth in the international front, IIT Kharagpur has lived up to every dream that Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru saw while laying our foundation stone. This place has been making leaders of the country proud since decades and we at International Relations Cell promise to do every little thing we can to help our dear university excel in every aspect. On this auspicious occasion of the 68th Foundation Day of IIT Kharagpur, let's just dive back to the past and recognise the magnificence that IIT Kgp has evolved to.

During the State visit of French President Emmanuel Macron to India at the invitation of Prime Minister Narendra Modi in March 2018, both the leaders called for increased people-to-people exchanges between India and France. As a follow up, The French Embassy and French Institute in India announced- Choose France Tour, a series of events with an aim to foster student and researcher’s mobility between India and France.
Each Choose France Tour is built around 3 sessions:
Thematic Workshop to discuss new joint cooperation initiatives in training, research and innovation.
Networking Lunch with professionals.
Student Fair to choose from exceptional higher education and research programs in France.
IIT Kharagpur students are requested to join the delegation of around 40 French engineering colleges, business schools, public universities, doctoral schools and enterprises taking place in four different Indian cities with a dedicated theme.
Bangalore Thursday, September 27th, 2018 IT & Artificial Intelligence.
Mumbai Saturday, September 29th, 2018 Valorisation of Bioactive Components.
Ahmedabad Sunday, September 30th, 2018 Smart Cities: Transportation and Urban Planning.
Kolkata Wednesday, October 3rd, 2018 Clean and Renewable Energies.
*No Registration Fee for Indian Institutions.
Website: www.frenchscienceindia.org

International Relations Cell informs students of IIT Kharagpur about The International Congress and Exhibition of Sciences and Innovative Technologies (ICESIT-2018), which takes place in Babol, Iran from 5 th to 6 th Sep 2018.
The aim of the conference is to provide an opportunity for researchers to present their ideas, proposals, or completed research in all areas of research to an international audience. The papers presented will be published in SCOPUS index journal. 
Topics of interest for submission include any topics as follows:
Nanotechnology, Nano-science, Advanced Materials, Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Petrochemical Engineering
Material, Industrial Engineering, Mechanical Engineering; Agricultural Sciences, Civil, Architecture and Environmental Engineering.
Registration fee starts at 200 USD.
Submit Abstract Before: August 20, 2018
For more information, please visit:
http://www.icesit.org
Inquiries: contact@icesit.org

We are delighted to inform you about the NCCU Elite Scholarship Program which provides a
full tuition waiver and a monthly living stipend.
 
NCCU is widely recognized for its expertise in education, the liberal arts, humanities and social
sciences, molding talent and leadership, and creating a force for positive change throughout
Taiwan and the world. To date, NCCU has hosted over 3,000 International Degree students from
more than 70 countries, offering them a unique opportunity to develop a strong international
outlook and regional expertise.
 
NCCU currently offers six Master’s and Doctoral degree programs taught entirely in English,
specially designed for international students. These include International Master’s & Doctoral
Programs in Asia-Pacific Studies, Communication, Economics, International Affairs and
Business (IDAS, IMAS, IMICS, IMES, IMPIS, and IMBA).
 
Information for International Degree Students for Spring 2019 admissions will be available at the
NCCU and OIC websites beginning September 7, 2018. Applications are accepted
from September 27, 2018 to October 22, 2018.
  
The NCCU Elite Scholarship Program provides a full tuition waiver and a monthly living stipend
for two years (Master’s program) or three years (Doctoral program), ensuring that international
students can focus all their attention and energy on their studies.
 
For further information-
- NCCU International Admission
- Elite Scholarship Program  
For any queries contact Carol at nccugrad@nccu.edu.tw.
Refer :  http://oic.nccu.edu.tw

more than 70 countries, offering them a unique opportunity to develop a strong international
outlook and regional expertise.
 
NCCU currently offers six Master’s and Doctoral degree programs taught entirely in English,
specially designed for international students. These include International Master’s & Doctoral
Programs in Asia-Pacific Studies, Communication, Economics, International Affairs and
Business (IDAS, IMAS, IMICS, IMES, IMPIS, and IMBA).
 
Information for International Degree Students for Spring 2019 admissions will be available at the
NCCU and OIC websites beginning September 7, 2018. Applications are accepted
from September 27, 2018 to October 22, 2018.
  
The NCCU Elite Scholarship Program provides a full tuition waiver and a monthly living stipend
for two years (Master’s program) or three years (Doctoral program), ensuring that international
students can focus all their attention and energy on their studies.
 
For further information-
- NCCU International Admission
- Elite Scholarship Program  
For any queries contact Carol at nccugrad@nccu.edu.tw.
Refer :  http://oic.nccu.edu.tw

International Relations Cell briefed sophomores on the ways to become an international student, in assimilation program.
In the one-hour session, IR Cell presented various initiatives such as Semester Away Program,  Student Exchange Program, Foreign training Program and various funding opportunities available for attending world-level conferences and competitions.
To add glory to the event, was present Shakul Pathak who went for a foreign training through FTP.
Also, Pavel, a Russian inbound student shared what all he experienced here in just one week of his stay. He also spoke a few words in Hindi which added fun to the event.

message:
Holla Sophomores!
In the recent times, it is observed that the desire to have an international exposure is increasing rapidly amongst students. There are several ways through which students can go abroad. Some of them are conferences, competitions, foreign internships, semester away program, etc. To let students know about all the ways through which they can have an international exposure, International Relations Cell presents you a session on “How to Become an International Student?” .
Venue : Netaji Auditorium
Date : August 5, 2018
Time: 11 am to 12 noon 
A quote by a student after getting international exposure:
“ Coming back was never that same as it was while leaving!”
Hope to see you there!

Hola Sophomore!!!

International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur welcomes you all back to the campus.
In your one year stay at IIT Kharagpur, you must have noticed that there are opportunities for both sending our students to international universities as well as bringing in International students to IIT Kharagpur. This is what International Relations Cell works for and it contributes significantly in determining the QS ranking of the institute. The recent improvement in our QS rankings glorifies the work we have done in the past few years and we are extremely motivated to take our institute further on the international front. Let us come together and work for our institute. Let us take KGP to new heights.

International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur is recruiting second years!!
Don't miss a chance to be a part of the IRC family!
Here is the link to the Google form to register for the group discussion:
https://goo.gl/forms/0MQTEe9paAtehrP43
Deadline to fill this form: 26th July

The Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, features among the top 100 in the Times Higher Education Golden Age University Rankings and top 50 in the Emerging University Rankings.
The Golden Age ranking casts spotlight on the best universities established for more than 50 years, but less than 80 years.The universities were measured across their "core missions" - teaching, research, citations, international outlook and industry income. University of California, San Diego, tops the list. IIT Kharagpur has been placed in the 76th position.
IIT KGP was also placed 45th in the list The Emerging Economies University Rankings 2018 which included 350 universities from 42 countries.

Read more at:
//economictimes.indiatimes.com/articleshow/64965639.cms?utm_source=contentofinterest&utm_medium=text&utm_campaign=cppst

You always have space for improvement, no matter how long you’ve been in the pursuit. With this in mind, IIT Kharagpur, the oldest of the sister IITs is continually climbing the ladder since the past 3 years. Striving towards excellence and a world class reputation in all fields, IIT Kharagpur has jumped 13 ranks up from 308 to 295, and is back into the league of the top 300 universities in the world in the QS World University Ranking.  Improvements have been recorded in the scores for International Faculty and International Students.
We are in the beginning of a great journey and with determination, focus and hard work we strive to keep moving ahead in all spheres, to place IIT Kharagpur among the top universities of the world.

We are delighted to announce a pilot program on Reciprocal Short-term Student Exchange between IIT Kharagpur and Texas A&M University. Three students from either campus are visiting the other for short term project works. This program demonstrates our commitment to build sustainable partnerships with world class institutions for mutual benefit. We hope to sign the agreement on reciprocal exchange with TAMU soon and make this exchange an annual event.  We extend a warm welcome to the students from Texas A&M University and hope they have an enriching experience at our institute. To know more about the programme and various facilities provided to the students, please go through the blog:

https://ircell.wordpress.com/2018/06/06/reciprocal-student-exchange-program-with-texas-am-university/

We are delighted to announce a pilot program on Reciprocal Short-term Student Exchange between IIT Kharagpur and Texas A&M University. Three students from either campus are visiting the other for short term project works. This program demonstrates our commitment to build sustainable partnerships with world class institutions for mutual benefit. We hope to sign the agreement on reciprocal exchange with TAMU soon and make this exchange an annual event.  We extend a warm welcome to the students from Texas A&M University and hope they have an enriching experience at our institute. IIT Kharagpur signs agreements with University of Melbourne and University of Newcastle of Australia, for joint study programmes. Meanwhile, the MoU with University of Newcastle is focused on joint academic and research programmes, joint supervision of doctoral and masters students and other exchange and knowledge sharing initiatives.

message:
It's the time of the Fourth Industrial Revolution!!  This opens up a galore of new opportunities. In order to convey the latest developments and develop the acumen of thinking the tech way, fundoo.info has been launched by an IIT Madras Alumnus. fundoo.info  brings in Industry Thought Leaders, Entrepreneurs and Academicians on a Webinar Channel -  Emerging Trends and Industry Insights. With the aim of hosting such leaders and provide a platform for young generation to learn, fundoo.info is organising webinars on various topics. Webinars on Blockchain, AI, Solar and Customer Success Management have already received  great response. More details on: https://fundoo.info 
fundoo.info invites IIT Kharagpur Alumni who are entrepreneurs and Thought Leaders as Guest Speakers and encourages the Kgp fraternity to follow the webinars in order to take edge of the latest developments in technology.

Grand Announcement for all the International students

IIT Kharagpur has revised its procedure for accepting foreign students for doctoral programs.
The change has been in the admission criteria of students not from a Dual Doctoral Program(DDP)  Partner Institution
Note : Admission criteria for Dual Doctoral Program(DDP) students from partner Institutions is governed by their MoUs.
For a non DPP Partner institution student the steps for admission are as follows:
Criteria set by Department /School/Centre that may include the applicant’s academic record, qualification and a sufficiently long interview administered in video conferencing mode.
TOEFL/GRE scores.
Two Letters of reference from professional contacts.
Applicant must also comply with the Govt. of India rules regarding his country of citizenship and current immigration status in India. If an applicant qualifies the given criteria and accepts the provisional offer letter, he/she is issued the visa letters as per Govt. rules.
After admission, all the PhD rules of the Institute will be applicable for the student, but there may be few exceptions for DDP student from a partner Institution.

Note : All the applicants have to fill up the preliminary application form and send it with all the attachments to  ir-office@adm.iitkgp.ac.in irrespective of the fact that they are from a DPP partner institute or not.
PLease have a look at both the links for details and for the application form
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1BO0Qz8Zq1TJr0ZeghlLs5BigoN9puI5l/view?usp=sharing
https://drive.google.com/file/d/10t49tVGhuDlRngliWwMbEw91_NPEFbra/view?usp=sharing

Reachivy Scholarship:

ReachIvy is a premium education & careers advisory firm that helps students get accepted into top-tier education institutions globally. 

ReachIvy Scholarship provides free support to students looking to apply to top-ranked colleges anywhere in the world. The scholarship is awarded to meritorious students, irrespective of their background or financial status.

Every year ReachIvy selects 5-10 students for its annual Scholarship where up to 5 winners get mentored by  team of Experts and upto 5 winners get free assistance on their applications. Academic performance is not the sole criteria.
Eligiblity: Applicats who are planning to start Masters program ( MBA and MS) between 2019 to 2022
Application Deadline: 31 May 2018
For more Information: https://www.reachivy.com/reachivy-scholarship.html

Universite De Lille, France is offering PhD positions to interested and eligible students at the IEMN Laboratory of the University. 
The subject title for the PhD is ‘ Acoustical tweezers based on acoustical vortices for the selective 3D contactless manipulation of micro-metric particles in a micro-fluidic environment.’

Interested Students at IIT Kharagpur are requested to take this into consideration and contact the respective Professor for the same.

IIT Kharagpur highly appreciates the efforts of the embassy of Japan, New Delhi to help in the release of the following scholarships. The Public Notices in respect to the aforementioned scholarships/fellowships have already been displayed on the website of the Ministry of Human Resource development i.e.  www.mhrd.gov.in/scholarships. 

1) Japanese Government [MEXT] Scholarship Program 2019 for Research Students
 Last Date of application: 01.06.2018
1. For Master’s degree:
Bachelor’s degree in relevant field with minimum 65% marks. The candidates should obtain their mark sheet and degree on or before 31st March 2019, for April 2019 batch and 30th September 2019 for October 2019 batch
2. For Ph.D. degree : 
Master’s degree in relevant field with minimum 65% marks. The candidates must have practical research/teaching/work experience after obtaining the prescribed qualification on or before 31st March 2019.

Age: born after April 2, 1984
Website: http://www.in.emb-japan.go.jp/Education/Research_Student.html

2) Japanese Government [MEXT] Scholarship Program 2019 for undergraduate students, college of technology students and specialized training college students
 Last Date of application: 15.06.2018
The scholarship offers the student to study as an Undergraduate student, College of Technology student and Specialized Training College student.
Website: http://www.in.emb-japan.go.jp/Education/japanese_government_scholarships.html

3) USIEF Fellowships for Indian Citizens: 2019-2020
Last Date of application: 15.06.2018

We are elated to announce the University of Newcastle Australia as a partnered university of IIT Kharagpur. An MoU facilitating the same has been signed between the two Institutions during the recently concluded trip to Australia by the Dean of International Relations, Prof. Baidurya Bhattacharya. The partnership aims to promote collaboration in academic and research activities. The two Institutions are now actively exploring student exchange and dual degree programs.  Please contact the Office of International Relations for more details.

Professor S. Jon Chapman and Professor Colin P. Please from the Mathematical Institute, University of Oxford are looking to fill two postdoc positions in the area of battery modeling. They are expecting to hire people from mathematics or people who have had a good experience in mathematical modeling. It is not necessary that the candidate has had prior experience in modeling batteries.

Details and further particulars can be found at:
https://www.maths.ox.ac.uk/node/28140

Applications for this vacancy are to be made online.  To apply for this post and for further details, including the job description and selection criteria, please click on the link below
https://www.recruit.ox.ac.uk/pls/hrisliverecruit/erq_jobspec_version_4.display_form

International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur is proud to announce that the website for International Relations of IIT KGP is now up and running with the joint efforts of the Cell and the Office of International Relations. 

To access, please visit www.international.iitkgp.ac.in

It contains various resources for IITKgp students and faculty, and for our international partners, such as information regarding different programs and funding. You can also access the FTP portal from the website.
We will keep updating the pages with new initiatives and information. We invite you to go through the contents and give your constructive suggestions.

International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur is elated to announce the results of IIT Kharagpur Foundation (IITKGPF) USA Award Program for International Student Internships. We appreciate Mr. Ranbir Gupta for the initiative and thank him for his extended support.

IITKGPF will now support these meritorious students for their International Internships. The value of the award will be administered directly by the IITKGPF.

International Relations Cell congratulates you all.

International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur is elated to announce the outcome of our initiative, the results of IIT Kharagpur Foundation (IITKGPF) USA Award Program for International Student Internships.

IITKGPF will now support these meritorious students for their International Summer Internships.The students shall be awarded an amount of 3000-5000 USD depending upon the quality of proposed research and academic standing and will be administered directly by IITKGPF.

IIT Kharagpur and International Relations Cell congratulates these students.

Selected students are requested contact OIR, IIT Kharagpur for information regarding dissemination of funding.

International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur takes great pride in announcing the grand success of the Foreign Training Portal. International Relations Cell is delighted at the success of MS/PhD seminar organized on Sunday, 18th March. Students who aspire to pursue higher education in future turned out in huge numbers and the panelists made sure that they explain the whole application procedure and enlighten them about the various aspects concerned with application for MS and PhD. All in all, we really hope that the students who attended the seminar were motivated and inspired.
Here are  a few glimpses of the seminar.

message:
Many students often miss out the opportunity to participate in foreign competitions due to lack of funding or other financial issues. To increase opportunities and exposure to international competitions, IR Cell presents you with the  IIT Kharagpur Foundation of USA Award Program for International Student Competitions.
This Program will support the most deserving student teams with partial support to attend high-quality international competitions.
Applications may be made through the Office of International Relations using the attached application form.

https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B0-WusIde2k4SFNZdDMyRTNWUkxIcHlOc1NfWGZvLU0yQks0

Details of the program:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Rm6F0ijiKzyA75PSrRUhBfxwcGVOLZHl/view?usp=sharing

For more details, please reach out to the Office of International Relations.

message:
“ The value of higher education is the not learning of many facts but training of mind to think.”
                                                                                                                               -Albert Einstein

The world is definitely a humongous stage and all humans are merely players, where the ultimate fight is for power acquisition. Everybody wants to acquire fame and engraved his / her name in the golden books of history.If statistics is taken into picture be it Mrs.Indra Nooyi, Dr. Sashi Tharoor or Dr. Manmohan Singh each of the successful Indians has one thing in common: they all are highly educated. In such times, it becomes essential for students to decide whether to pursue higher education or go for corporate jobs. International relations cell, therefore, presents the MS/ Ph.D. panel discussion to help students clear all their doubts regarding MS/ Ph.D. application procedure. Hope to see you see there!

Hola First Years!
Do you wish to have an insight on how International Relations Cell contributes in improving the global ranking of IIT Kharagpur? 
Here lies the opportunity. 
Register at http://bit.ly/IRCELL2018
International Relations Cell IIT Kharagpur opens its doors for the first years to be a “Theme for our Team”. Through this selection, we provide first years the opportunities to solve a number of intensive case studies and analyze various programs that could benefit IIT Kgp at the global level.
Like Audrey Hepburn always says “Opportunities don’t often come along. So when they do, you have to grab them.”
So grab a motive and be there!
Well, we are not done yet. We are also selecting the design team and web team members. So all the interested newbies do come!

S-Set sail on an international adventure                                 
E-Escalate your technical and cultural skills
P-Perceive the best opportunity of a lifetime

IR cell is proud to announce the first of its kind initiative in the history of IIT Kgp, the commencement of the Reciprocal Student Exchange Program. Years of continued efforts are now resulting in unique collaborations between IIT Kgp and global institutions on mutual exchange of value basis. We are elated to announce the first such collaboration with the Leibniz University of Hanover, Germany. Applications are now open for 4 opportunities under the program with tuition fee waiver and free accommodation at the host university. We believe this is a great start and encourage every student to explore SEP. Please follow the prescribed application procedure under SAP on our website: international.iitkgp.ac.in

We believe in growing by increasing exposure to the students and hope this will open a plethora of options in the future. We assure you many great collaborations in the near future!!

French Embassy in India and Institut Francais en Inde (IFI) is organizing the Future tour for the first time that brings together scientists, academics and companies to discuss future partnerships between India and France under the third edition of Bonjour India in five different cities from 29th January - 18th February 2018.

The last step of this Future Tour will be organized on 17th and 18th February in Ahmedabad on the topic: "Smart cities: urban planning, architecture, and design".
 
Draft program :
Day 1 17th Feb at CEPT :
9 am: Opening session
Two parallel sessions of 4 Round Tables each, one session on Saturday morning (9:30 to 12 am) and the second one on Saturday afternoon (2 to 5 pm). And a networking dinner on Saturday evening at NOVOTEL Ahmedabad.
 
Day 2 18th Feb at NIRMA University
On Sunday morning there will be some presentations of existing Indo French partnerships as well as a session dedicated to PPP.
Sunday afternoon: one to one meetings between students, alumni, universités, and companies. 
Kindly refer to the following links for details about the programme:
https://www.campusfrance.org/en/agenda/future-tours-india-2018

Around 6-8 people will be invited to each roundtable.

https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B0-WusIde2k4NS1KMnlMWUp6OXUyMVowTUQxeW1hV2daU3FJ

Caltech's Summer Undergraduate Research Fellowships (SURF) program introduces students to research under the guidance of seasoned research mentors at Caltech and JPL.

SURF is modeled on the grant-seeking process:

Students collaborate with a potential mentor to define and develop a project
Applicants write research proposals as part of the application process
Faculty review the proposals and recommend awards
Students carry out the work over a 10-week period during the summer
At the conclusion of the program, students submit a technical paper and give an oral presentation at one of several SURF Seminar Days, symposia modeled on a professional technical meeting.
Fellows receive a $6,275 award for the ten-week period. Award payments are distributed in equal installments in late June and late July. 
For all further details kindly refer to the following link:
https://www.sfp.caltech.edu/programs/surf

The Department of Science & Technology (DST), Govt. of India and Indo-U.S. Science & Technology Forum (IUSSTF) has jointly announced a new fellowship program for Women "Indo-U.S. Fellowship for Women in STEMM (WISTEMM)" (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics and Medicine).The program aims to provide opportunities to Indian Women Scientists, Engineers & Technologists to undertake international collaborative research in premier institutions in the U.S.A, to enhance their research capacities and capabilities.The deadline for submission of applications is 28 th February 2018. This is a great opportunity for Indian women students to gain ground in their respective research areas. IR cell encourages all eligible Kgp’ians to make use of the opportunity. For more info, refer to the following link: https://drive.google.com/file/d/16_bp-e8GQDAvODL7bvffbraVmeqAuXdC/view?usp=sharing

The Department of Science & Technology (DST), Govt. of India and Indo-U.S. Science & Technology Forum (IUSSTF) has jointly announced a new fellowship program for Women "Indo-U.S. Fellowship for Women in STEMM (WISTEMM)" (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics and Medicine).The program aims to provide opportunities to Indian Women Scientists, Engineers & Technologists to undertake international collaborative research in premier institutions in the U.S.A, to enhance their research capacities and capabilities.The deadline for submission of applications is 28 th February 2018. This is a great opportunity for Indian women students to gain ground in their respective research areas. IR cell encourages all eligible Kgp’ians to make use of the opportunity. For more info, refer to the following link: https://drive.google.com/file/d/16_bp-e8GQDAvODL7bvffbraVmeqAuXdC/view?usp=sharing

Nanyang Technological University, Singapore hosts The NTU-India Connect Research Internship Programme which is a university-wide short-term research programme that lasts for 2 to 6 months.Students of this programme will work under the supervision of NTU faculty, develop a strong research interest and expertise in a given research field, experience multicultural living, gain a network of friends and a better understanding of Singapore.
 
Eligible students may be given an allowance and are expected to fulfil a minimum of 2 months research attachment involving research project work at NTU. Student will also receive a certificate issued by NTU-India Connect office upon completion of the programme.

Please read the following important note before applying:​ 

Internship Period

NTU-India Connect Research Internship Programme 2018 will fall within the following periods:-

Batch 1 (3rd January 2018 to 1st June 2018)
Batch 2 (8th May 2018 to 13th July 2018)
Batch 3 (1st August 2018 to 31st December 2018)
​​For Batch 1 and 3, students are encouraged to stay for a minimum of 5 months.
For Batch 2, students are encouraged to stay for a minimum of 2 months.

Application Period
The opening and closing dates for NTU-India Connect Research Internship Programme 2018 is stated below.

Batch 1 (15th July 2017 to 31 August 2017)
Batch 2 (1st November 2017 to 31st December 2017)
Batch 3 (1st February 2018 to 31st March 2018)​

Eligibility Criteria
Open to Pre-final year graduates / undergraduates who have not studied in NTU previously.

​​Qualification ​Duration ​Eligible period ​
 B Tech / B.Sc. (Degree) 
​4 years Pre-final year - End of 3rd year​
​M Tech / M.Sc. (Master) ​2 years Pre-final year - End of 1st year​​
​M + B / M.Sc. + B.Sc. 
(Dual Degree)​ ​5 years ​Pre-final year - End of 4th year​​
Students must possess good academic track records. 
M​ust be a student pursuing his / her studies in an Indian University / Institute of higher learning upon the period of his / her internship with NTU. 
Students that meet the minimum requirement with scholarships, publication and internship experiences will be given preference.​​
For all further details about the application procedure and other details,kindly visit: http://global.ntu.edu.sg/GMP/ic/Pages/default.aspx

An important announcement by the board members has marked a new milestone for the IRCell by appointment of a new Dean to oversee all our activities. Prof. Baidurya Bhattacharya will lead us as the Dean of International Relations henceforth. We have come a long way since the inception of the cell and now we wish to thrive under the new leadership of Dean Baidurya Bhattacharya. It'll be our immense pleasure to work under his guidance and build the international relations of IIT KGP. We are assured that he'll help us touch new heights with his vision. A hearty welcome to him and a new beginning!

IR Cell, IIT Kharagpur is exhilarated with student’s response for application of foreign internship at the Foreign Training Portal.

The students are kindly requested to take a note of the following points:-

1. The deadline of application for the first series of project has been extended to 31st of January, 6:00 P.M. (IST). No further extension will be done under any circumstances.

2. The students can apply with a CV specific to the project. The students have to register with one single CV, however, the student may upload a new CV specific to the project in the “apply now” tab. This new CV (if uploaded) will be shared with the concerned professor for application.

3. Both UG and PG students can apply for the projects on the portal. If a student is facing difficulties with any part of the application process, he/she may reach out to us at:-

 irc@iitkgp.ac.in 

4. The students are requested to keep checking our Facebook page and the portal for new projects to apply.

The link to the portal is:-

 http://www.ircell.iitkgp.ac.in/ftp/portal/login/

For any queries, please contact

Shubham Arora

The IU School of Informatics, Computing, and Engineering at Indiana University, Bloomington provides a ten-week summer research program named IU-SROC (Summer Research Opportunities in Computing) . This is to attract high potential undergraduate students to do research in the fields of computer science, bioinformatics, human centered computing, computer vision, health informatics, security, cloud computing, Interactive Intelligent Systems, text mining and high performance computing.

Eligibility: Full-time undergraduate student in an accredited university anywhere in the world.
Period: 8-10 weeks during the summer months of May through July.

Application Deadline: February 16, 2018

Application Material:

1. CV, highlighting top academic and research performances 
2. An unofficial transcript from the college you are currently attending (an official transcript will be required once a participation offer has been accepted) 
3. At least one letter of recommendation from a faculty member

Fellowship : $5000 + housing and a meal plan for this ten-week program

Description :This full time research experience includes work in the lab with a faculty and PhD student mentor, weekly professional development colloquia series and a technical writing workshop. At the conclusion of the program, all students participate in the IU Summer STEM Scholars research poster session and closing ceremony. Participants will have to prepare both oral and written summaries of their research projects.

For completing the entire application process please visit: 

https://iu.co1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_01zb9jiggRqnIvH

French Embassy in India and Institut Francais en Inde (IFI) is organizing the Future tour for the first time that brings together scientists, academics and companies to discuss future partnerships between India and France under the third edition of Bonjour India in five different cities from 29th January - 18th February 2018.
The objective of these Future Tours are:
- to bring about joint initiatives in training, research and innovation.
- to promote the French training offer and to meet the students.
The agenda of the meeting is also to explore possibilities of collaboration and to deliver recommendations for the first high level Indo-French Knowledge Summit which will transpire in New Delhi in mid-March 2018 in the presence of President of France and Prime Minister of India. 

This Summit will bring together academia and industry from both countries to create a road map for education, research cooperation and mobility for the next 5 years.

https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B0-WusIde2k4NS1KMnlMWUp6OXUyMVowTUQxeW1hV2daU3FJ

With immense progress in science and technology, the young generation has failed to witness the rich culture and heritage of India. There are many organisations and individuals who are working hard to make an attempt in preserving this rich culture of our motherland. Keeping the same in mind, an international convention will be organised by SPIC MACAY, IIT Kharagpur and The Bengal Chamber at the IIT Kharagpur campus from June 3 to June 9. Aimed mainly at promotion of Indian Classical music and culture among youth this programme will have participants from different countries apart from various parts of India.
Kindly refer to the given link for further information

This post is meant for all the students who are aspiring for graduate studies especially from Computer Science stream.
The million dollar question: What next?
Each one of us wonders about the prospects of future after completion of our course. While USA and Canada seems like the lucrative choices for graduate studies, it is still hard to decide if you want to invest that amount of money and effort. Now get your queries answered in an extremely interactive session by Prof. Sourabh Bagchi from Purdue University.
Get insights on the subject and decide the best for your future! 
Date: Jan 9, 2018
Venue: V 1
Time: 6 PM

Do you have an idea that can revolutionize mobility? Do you have an idea that can compete with the Hyperloop? If yes, here is your chance to showcase your talents. The French Embassy in India is organizing Easy Ride, a 2-day hackathon on the theme of smart and sustainable mobility. Easy Ride is a prototype and design competition that brings together teams of creative and ingenious students to come with innovative solutions on the theme of Smart and Sustainable Mobility. 
All the interested students are supposed to contact Mrs. Alivia Nag(alivia.nag@adm.iitkgp.ernet.in), International Relations Executive of IIT Kharagpur at the Office of International Relations. 
Please refer to the following link for more details: https://www.veltechuniv.edu.in/easy-ride/

Self Recommendation Letter | NTU-India Connect Programme

Since, we have been getting several requests regarding the self recommendation letter for NTU-India Connect Programme, in view of public interest, we suggest a few guidelines for the same. Self recommendation letter should have the following details:
1.Name
2.Year and department
3.Your competencies, achievements and awards
4.Your CGPA    
5.Your interests and why do you want to join NTU India Connect
   Programme

Please refer to the following link for a sample self recommendation letter: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ORdvW9-rzIUJehNpT5EEGICVpyhVgnDTlIiNy1FAkAQ/edit?usp=sharing

IR Cell presents you with Global Leadership Series, a unique series of interviews, discussions and guest lectures about leadership at the global stage. Today, we have with us Ranbir (Ron) Singh Gupta, a distinguished alumnus of IIT Kharagpur from the batch of 1970, B.Arch. Ron Gupta is a top-notch architect in the US with his own company based in New York. Along with his wife, Chitra, Ron created the “Ranbir and Chitra Gupta School of Infrastructure Design and Management“ (RCGSIDM), first such school of its kind in the world. Here is a short discussion on his philosophy of giving back, objectives of the RCGSIDM School and some advice for the young entrepreneurs.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mrIYXsEM11Q

S.T.E.A.M School - an interdisciplinary hands-on  education and problem-solving programme, based on United Nation's Sustainable  Development Goals is conducting a 10-day programme, an immersive  experience with a mix of project-based learning, field trials, mentoring  sessions and digital prototyping. Participants include students,  academicians, scientists, engineers, architects, doctors, environmentalists,  strategists and artists besides others in the creative economy.  This presents a unique opportunity for innovative and dynamic students to  interact with a different cohort of people involved in social purpose. IR Cell encourages every IIT Kharagpur student to participate in it. Follow this link to apply:  https://steam.makersasylum.com/school/
